metadata.description: Sources exported from database - always most updated version

1.name: AF Washington DC
1.description: Alliance Fran√ßaise Washington DC promotes French cultural events, language classes, art exhibitions, and Franco-American cultural activities.

2.description: City Cast DC podcast and media account covering local news, events, and happenings in Washington DC. Features interviews, event coverage, and community discussions.

3.description: DC 4 Free highlights free events, activities, and attractions in Washington DC. Perfect for budget-conscious residents and visitors looking for free cultural experiences.

4.description: DC Art All Night promotes late-night art events, gallery openings, and cultural happenings across Washington DC. Features local artists, exhibitions, and creative community events.

38.name: NYC Arts
38.description: Official NYC arts and culture account showcasing events, exhibitions, and cultural happenings across all five boroughs.
38.notes: Official NYC government arts account. Highly reliable source for major cultural events and exhibitions across NYC.
38.scraping_pattern: Look for posts about art exhibitions, gallery openings, cultural events, and artist showcases. Monitor hashtags like #NYCArts, #NYCCulture, #ArtExhibitions, #GalleryOpenings.

39.name: Time Out New York

39.notes: Established NYC culture and events publication. Excellent source for comprehensive event coverage across all categories.
39.scraping_pattern: Look for posts about events, exhibitions, concerts, theater, food events, and cultural happenings. Monitor hashtags like #TimeOutNYC, #NYCEvents, #NYCCulture, #NYCFood.

46.name: NYC.com
46.description: Comprehensive NYC events calendar covering attractions, events, restaurants, and activities across all five boroughs.
46.notes: Comprehensive NYC events website. Good source for broad coverage of events and attractions across all categories.
46.scraping_pattern: Look for event listings, attraction information, restaurant events, and activity recommendations. Monitor for event announcements and cultural programming updates.

47.name: Gothamist
47.description: Gothamist covers NYC news, events, and culture with a focus on local happenings and community events.
47.notes: Local NYC news and culture publication. Good source for community events, neighborhood happenings, and local cultural programming.
47.scraping_pattern: Look for posts about community events, neighborhood happenings, local culture, festivals, and free events. Monitor hashtags like #Gothamist, #NYCLocal, #CommunityEvents, #NeighborhoodEvents.

48.name: Big Onion Walking Tours
48.description: Big Onion Walking Tours offers historical and cultural walking tours throughout NYC. Founded in 1991, they provide in-depth guided tours exploring neighborhoods including Greenwich Village, Lower East Side, Brooklyn, Harlem, Financial District, and more. Tours focus on history, architecture, immigration, labor, social justice, and Revolutionary War era.
48.notes: Award-winning historical walking tour company. 'Best Place To Take Out Of Town Guests' - Village Voice 2014. Tours led by graduate students and historians. Covers all major NYC neighborhoods with themed tours including Revolutionary NY, Gangs of NY, Immigrant NY, Greenwich Village, Brooklyn Bridge, Harlem Renaissance, Jewish Lower East Side, and multi-ethnic food tours.
48.scraping_pattern: Check the tours page for scheduled walking tours across NYC neighborhoods. Look for tour dates, times, meeting locations, and special themed tours. Tours typically include: Lower Manhattan, Greenwich Village, Brooklyn Heights, Central Park, Harlem, Lower East Side, Chelsea, East Village, Upper East Side, and specialty food/holiday tours.

49.name: Ellis Island Hard Hat Tours
49.description: Save Ellis Island offers exclusive 90-minute Hard Hat Tours of the abandoned south side of Ellis Island, including the Contagious Disease Hospital abandoned since 1954. Tours run 7 days a week year-round with multiple daily time slots. Explore areas off-limits to the public including the morgue, laundry facility, kitchen, wards, and doctors residence. Features the Unframed Ellis Island exhibit by French artist JR.
49.notes: Unique Hard Hat Tours of Ellis Island's abandoned hospital buildings. Tours run daily from 10:30am to 4pm with 6 different time slots. Minimum age 10 years old. $55 per tour (ferry tickets sold separately). Proceeds support preservation efforts. Also offers Group Tours, Photography Tours, and School Programs. Contact: 201-332-8485 or reservations@saveellisisland.org
49.scraping_pattern: Check tour availability and schedule for Hard Hat Tours. Daily tours at: 10:30am-12pm (Early Bird), 11:30am-1pm, 12pm-1:30pm, 12:30pm-2pm, 1:30pm-3pm, 2:30pm-4pm. Monitor special photography tours, group tours, and school programs. Look for seasonal events and special exhibits.
